definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Keep it in mind, and then turn your approach to the question on its head by asking not "Are stocks cheap?"
sentences.chinese: 把它牢牢記在心頭，然後把話頭從“股票便宜嗎？”

sentences.english: All Party comrades must keep these lessons of history firmly in mind.
sentences.chinese: 這些歷史教訓，全黨同志都要牢記。

sentences.english: Health experts suggest five numbers to remember and to drink enough water each day.
sentences.chinese: 專家建議牢記五個數字，讓身體喝足水。

sentences.english: Hard Corps is the only way I know.
sentences.chinese: 硬漢團殺身成仁我牢記。

sentences.english: We will keep in mind your earnest words.
sentences.chinese: 我們會牢記您的諄諄話語。

sentences.english: Always remember that the Borzoi is a coursing Sighthound and follows its instinct to chase.
sentences.chinese: 請牢記，獵狼是視覺獵犬，他會追尋他的本能去獵捕。

sentences.english: We must bear in mind the trust of the party and the people, and resolutely to complete their tasks.
sentences.chinese: 我們一定要牢記黨和人民的重託，堅決完成任務。

sentences.english: The " Remember the maine" of Spanish war days has now been changed to "Remember Pearl Harbor.
sentences.chinese: 是“牢記緬因河”，如今已換成“牢記珍珠港”了。

sentences.english: The " Remember the maine" of Spanish war days has now been changed to "Remember Pearl Harbor.
sentences.chinese: 是“牢記緬因河”，如今已換成“牢記珍珠港”了。

sentences.english: M en allways remember love because of romantic only .
(Psalm 127:2 LB) Some of you need to put that on your briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 你們中有些人還需要把他放到公文包裏牢記。

sentences.english: He didn't bother whether the Prince had taken his own advice to his heart or not.
sentences.chinese: 他不在乎國王是否將他自己的忠告牢記於心。

sentences.english: People say those, who do not remember their past, do not deserve the future.
sentences.chinese: 常言道，不牢記過去的人，不配擁有未來。

sentences.english: Keep in mind some of the guiding principals discussed for use during this process.
sentences.chinese: 請牢記所討論的這一過程中使用的一些指導原則。

sentences.english: This is a key point to keep in mind with all of these dynamic programming algorithms.
sentences.chinese: 這是在所有動態編程算法中都要牢記的關鍵點。

definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
to hold fast to/to stick to

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
top priority job/matter of vital importance
a heavy load and a long road/fig. to bear heavy responsibilities through a long struggle (cf Confucian Analects, 8.7)
